metadata.name: drawz fxh_t019 #248
metadata.description:
'drawz' fxh_t019 is also vanilla javascript template for fxhash


feel free, to use (parts of) it, and learn from the source.
and use it as a start for your own creative projects and adventures

This version has some extra routines you can use; 
and a lot of comments in the source


A cleaned up - smaller version; just doing the basic tech screen & window-handeling etc. with just drawing dots can be found here.
(and older and newer updated versions)
https://elout.home.xs4all.nl/drawz/


Mostly I start with a clean template; 
then add: copy-paste routines into it. Things I want to use; sprites, text-font, filters, lines, 3D etc. 
Like kinda lego blocks. Some routines I re-use for 30 years now. 
Although often they have changed over time.


Vanilla javascript - And directly control your rgb buffer
-------------------------------------------------------------------
cons:
- can be overwhelming for starting coders compared to p5js
- you have to write / use and tinker with new drawing routines by yourself. 
- still can be optimized a lot, and run much faster
-- (feel free to do that! - release new versions yourself)
- I just coded it in Notepad++ and tested it in a browser.
- I have no experience with git-hub, or those other nifty tools
- I'm more an Artist than a coder, still learning new things as well.
- I have my own 'old' coding style I picked up ages ago, and still use now and then. Started with basic and Z80a as a teenager.
- for sure there are still some stupid bugs, spelling errors in it  ^___^

pros:
- fxtemplate - fxpreview when done drawing / splash-screen support on top; while drawing.
- do like 4000 x 4000 images on safari; on an old Iphone 5
- just 1 index.html now - small file size: 
- the source of the 'cleaned-up' version is now 34b (not minified, and still comments in the source; can be even smaller)
- direct control of the RGB buffer; every pixel.
- I added some basic routines, like drawing points, lines, squares, sprite-brushes, filters, and my pixel-font
- draw, add-mix or subtract - manipulate every pixel how you wish
- I work with a big off-screen kind of image; a rgb-buffer; so drawing goes 'mucho' faster and render it to a screen-scaled image.
- no other libraries used
----------------------------------------------------------------
Mouse-click switches between:
- screen scaled image
- The large image 

- The work will refresh and restart after some time

Save image - with s-key 
(includes the fxhash key-seed and num# of the follow-up images)
--- It can take some seconds before the saving happens; 
--- the browser has to handle (very) large MB .png files first 
--- before it can save them 

- splash image support - to hide drawing at start
- redraw the image after a while; or not.
- mouse position check for the bigger image
- fps counter for testing etc.
----------------------------------------------------------------
written in vanilla JavaScript, more info in the source-code


drawz - latest or an updated version can be found at.
https://elout.home.xs4all.nl/drawz/

It would be nice; to include more routines into it
in the future.

And instead of 1 big library with everything in it
I would like to have these templates; 
where you can add different little snippets and routines 
that you want to use into it, and start playing next.
Still learning new things as well. And getting inspired.

I don't mind people to use the tech-source as a start for their own projects. 

But the palette, and composition & structure build-up; is mine. 
Don't change just 1 or 2 -things then re-release it.

If you want to release something of your own,
your sketch and generative work; really should look total different!
You can use the technics to draw new things,
but you have to start from scratch again; 
choosing points, lines etc. to play with and go from there.
Enjoy! 


-for the love of Art and jumping in rain puddles-

'like jimi and guitar'  0__.  ^____^


xxx  amsterdam  chillout

September 29, 2022

metadata.description:
Generative gradient patterns, mirror form, noise texture, and made with code in Hydra.

* Click or touch the visual screen for sound.
(audio created with modular synthesizer in VCV Rack)

More info :
twitter.com/FahmiMursyid
instagram.com/_fahmi_mursyid_

metadata.name: Chaos studies 01 #94
metadata.description:
This is a study in chaotic systems, its my second iteration. This is an improvement over the first version, the system glitches out much less now, patterns are more stable and I've introduced colors in this version.

Made with P5js.

metadata.name: Drip #14
metadata.description: Dripping psychedelic liquid glooping down your screen. Variables include wave scale, speed, palette, and wave depth.

metadata.name: Drip #46
metadata.description: Dripping psychedelic liquid glooping down your screen. Variables include wave scale, speed, palette, and wave depth.

metadata.name: Sandscapes #65
metadata.description:
Sandscapes generates multiple scenarios drawn with a random mix of colors with a noise reinterpretation.

Outputs are diverse with a common mist ambient, transporting the viewer to different environments such as sand dunes, red sunsets, purple sunrises, mountains, rivers, skin texture, or simply an elegant background with a unique mix of colors.

--
Sandscapes genera multiples escenarios dibujados con una mezcla aleatoria de colores y una reinterpretación con ruido.

Las imágenes son diversas con un ambiente de neblina común, y trasladan al espectador a diferentes entornos tales como dunas de arena, rojos atardeceres, violetas amaneceres, montañas, rios, textura de piel, o sencillamente un elegante background con una mezcla de colores única.

metadata.name: Solitude Meditation #6
metadata.description:
"A room, a space, a solitude corner within the inner thought. Existed as a place to meditate and replenish the soul to be more at ease."

This piece means to mimic a sense of a dark room that contains radiated warm lights with subtle movement. It will follow the current resolution of the window where it is placed.

/////INTERACTIVITY/////
Do all the instructions below after opening the live mode.

1. To capture the screen, press the "c" button on your computer keyboard.

2. To save a 3-second .GIF from your iteration, press the "s" button on your computer keyboard. Please be patient while waiting for the piece to save and render its frames.

3. To adjust the piece resolution, you need to set your browser first and then reload the browser every time you want to capture the screen or save the rendered .GIF file.
///////////////////////

Created using Hydra and p5.js

Rangga Purnama Aji, 2022
https://linktr.ee/ranggapuraji

metadata.name: Spradow #44
metadata.description:
A girl ventured into a dark jungle and encountered spiders. As she tried to leave, the hills and woods seemed to move and block her escape. She became trapped in the jungle, and despite search efforts by others, she was never found. Legend has it that her cries can still be heard in the village for over thousands of years.

Pressing the “i” key will invert the colors of the artwork, allowing you to see it in negative mode. Use this feature to explore new perspectives on this already stunning piece. If you want to save your favorite iterations of the artwork, press S to save your current image as a high-resolution file. Alternatively, pressing T allows you to save just the transparent layer so that you can superimpose it onto other images or backgrounds easily.

metadata.name: a pale reflection #85
metadata.description:
a canvas is prepared; grids and vignette applied.

marks are added (or not)

a drawing method is chosen

the drawing method is iterated, resulting in a heavily stippled image

the image is sent to a shader

various maths occur inside the shader

the resulting shaded image is then given a border

and thus to the screen

a pale reflection - original music here: https://rtsixty.bandcamp.com/track/pale-reflection 
listen while waiting to be signed.

99.9% of royalties to original minter.

metadata.name: Splinter #200
metadata.description:
This release marks my first anniversary on the fx(hash) platform! I want to extend a huge thank you to everyone for a fantastic year, and I'm looking forward to many more in the generative-art world!

The basic algorithm is an evolution of the one I used in my first release, Raked Strokes. Instead of mimicking a brush with parallel segments, I'm using perpendicular line segments to define the overall abstract shape and then drawing each line in a simulated media. This approach blends my first attempts at natural media with everything I've learned in the past year.

Viewing in desktop Chrome is recommended for the best results.
Press 's' to save a screenshot. The image size is 2357x3000px
Press 'p' to pause/resume during drawing.

Features
- Base path shape: line, circle, diamond, or rectangle
- Elements defining the spacing and orientation of the line segments
- The base path painted in the background
- Monochrome, dark background, and selection of palettes
- Ink pen styling: thickness, quality, and background blocking
- Paint styling: color distribution, quality
- Shapes: triangle, polygons, criteria for insertion
- Shapes overdrawing: outlines or perpendicular segments

Copyright (c) 2022 Matt Perkins, hello@mattperkins.me, @nudoru on Twitter. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: A Stroll through the Garden #198
metadata.description:
Exploring the medium, physical, digital, made with AI, is an endless and exciting walk through a garden full of discoveries and hidden corners.

The choice of linocut aesthetics is connected with the personal background as an artist who worked with graphic techniques, childhood memories and feelings of trees deprived of their leaves in winter.

Thanks to YulikolaY for getting the code ready for production.

Made with love, AI and p5.js code

January, 2023

metadata.name: geometric painting #45
metadata.description:
Digital painting with 3 layers of different patterns
Layers of lines and noise
and two layers of jumbled forms
I hope you like it
